hatemhelal commented on issue #4985: ARROW-6096: [C++] conditionally use boost regex for gcc < 4.9
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4985#issuecomment-517341042
 
 
   I don't think this is quite right since the arrow library depends on boost regex:
   
   ```
   otool -L debug/libarrow.100.0.0.dylib
   debug/libarrow.100.0.0.dylib:
   	@rpath/libarrow.100.dylib (compatibility version 100.0.0, current version 100.0.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib/libcrypto.1.0.0.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib/libssl.1.0.0.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/glog/lib/libglog.0.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.4.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/lz4/lib/liblz4.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.9.1)
   	/usr/local/opt/snappy/lib/libsnappy.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.1.7)
   	/usr/lib/libz.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.2.11)
   	/usr/local/opt/zstd/lib/libzstd.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.4.1)
   	/usr/local/opt/boost/lib/libboost_system-mt.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/boost/lib/libboost_filesystem-mt.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	/usr/local/opt/boost/lib/libboost_regex-mt.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 400.9.4)
   	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1252.200.5)
   ```

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
There appears to be only one place where the boost regex library is used:

[cpp/src/parquet/metadata.cc|https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/eb73b962e42b5ae6983bf026ebf825f1f707e245/cpp/src/parquet/metadata.cc#L32]

I think this can be replaced by the C++11 regex library.
fields.summary: [C++] Conditionally depend on boost regex library

comments.body: I'm working on a patch for this as it seems useful to remove the runtime dependency on libboost_regex
[~hatem] This was in the past the C++ regex library but we had some issues. [~wesmckinn] [~mdeepak] Do you remember the problems with that?
Oh thanks for the heads up [~xhochy].  I'll have a closer look through the git history to see if I can find the previous trouble.
The regex implementation is incomplete in gcc 4.8.x which is used to compile on some platforms (notably manylinux1) so I don't think it's possible to use that.

Thanks for the quick reply.  I found this:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12530406/is-gcc-4-8-or-earlier-buggy-about-regular-expressions

I naively thought this would be a direct swap.
We may be able to drop gcc 4.8.x support at some point but I don't think we can do so right now
Perhaps it would be useful to use this ticket to add a comment to the code recording this history so it will be clear to future developers why it's there (and when it's safe to remove).

I'd like to spend sometime understanding whether we can conditionally link with boost regex only for gcc < 4.9.  I think that might satisfy my need (minimal dependency on boost) while keeping python wheels working on manylinux1.

Depending how that looks, I may just go with [~npr]'s suggestion as its useful to incorporate this requirement.
I made an initial stab at this in the linked PR.
